episodeTitle: Burning Roller Race! Dash into the Final Round!
episodeTitleJapanese: 白熱爆走レース！最終ラウンド突入！
episodeTitleRomanized: Hakunetsu bakusō rēsu! Saishū raundo totsunyū!
description: The Roller Race competition reaches its climax as the Straw Hat Pirates face off against the Foxy Pirates in the final round. With Chopper's fate hanging in the balance, the team must overcome Foxy's dirty tricks and Luffy's inability to skate. Nami and Usopp devise a plan to exploit Foxy's ego, while Robin's tactical brilliance and teamwork lead to victory.

events.title: Final Round of Roller Race Begins
events.description: The final round of the Roller Race competition begins with the Straw Hat team (Luffy, Nami, Usopp, Zoro, Sanji, and Robin) facing the Foxy Pirates team (Foxy, Porche, Hamburg, and other members) on roller skates around a circular track. The stakes are high with Chopper still in the possession of the Foxy Pirates.
events.significance: The climactic competition that will determine whether the Straw Hats can win back Chopper from the Foxy Pirates after losing him in earlier rounds.

events.title: Zoro and Sanji's Effective Teamwork
events.description: Despite their usual rivalry and constant bickering, Zoro and Sanji demonstrate excellent teamwork during the roller race. Sanji uses his knowledge of ingredients and cooking to identify weaknesses in their opponents, particularly helping to counter Chiqicheetah's speed. Zoro provides reliable support by retrieving items from the long kiwi trees.
events.significance: Showcases that despite their antagonistic relationship, Zoro and Sanji can work together effectively when the situation demands it, a recurring theme throughout the series.

events.title: Sanji Defeats Chiqicheetah Using Ingredient Knowledge
events.description: Sanji uses his encyclopedic knowledge of ingredients to exploit Chiqicheetah's weaknesses. By understanding the cheetah's dietary needs and vulnerabilities, Sanji manages to defeat the fast Foxy Pirate member, demonstrating that his cooking expertise translates to combat intelligence.
events.significance: Highlights Sanji's unique skill set beyond just his fighting abilities, showing how his culinary knowledge can be applied tactically in battle situations.

events.title: Nami and Usopp's Psychological Strategy Against Foxy
events.description: Nami devises a clever plan to exploit Foxy's fragile ego and emotional vulnerabilities. She and Usopp begin hurling insults and taunts at Foxy, attempting to distract him and throw him off his game during the race. Their strategy involves psychological warfare to disrupt his concentration.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' willingness to use unconventional tactics and shows Nami's strategic thinking beyond just navigation.

events.title: Foxy Uses Noro Noro Beam on Nami and Usopp
events.description: Foxy retaliates against Nami and Usopp's psychological tactics by using his Noro Noro no Mi Devil Fruit ability. He fires his signature Noro Noro Beam (Slow-Slow Beam), hitting both Nami and Usopp. The beam slows them down dramatically for thirty seconds, temporarily removing them from the competition.
events.significance: Demonstrates Foxy's primary combat ability and his willingness to cheat using his Devil Fruit powers during the Davy Back Fight games.

events.title: Nami Steals Porche's Hypnotizing Baton
events.description: Despite being slowed by Foxy's beam, Nami manages to steal Porche's hypnotizing baton before being fully incapacitated. This theft compensates for her and Usopp being taken out of the race temporarily and prevents Porche from using the hypnosis ability on other Straw Hat members.
events.significance: Shows Nami's quick thinking and thieving skills even under adverse conditions, preventing further disadvantages for her team.

events.title: Robin Physically Rolls Luffy Around the Track
events.description: With Nami and Usopp temporarily slowed down by Foxy's beam, and Luffy unable to roller skate properly, Robin takes matters into her own hands. She physically rolls and carries Luffy around the track, compensating for his inability to skate while maintaining their position in the race.
events.significance: A comedic yet practical moment showcasing Robin's willingness to do whatever it takes to help the crew, and highlighting the filler nature of Luffy's skating incompetence (which doesn't appear in the manga).

events.title: Robin's Tactical Walking Off Course Strategy
events.description: Robin demonstrates her tactical brilliance by deliberately walking off the course when Foxy targets her with his Noro Noro Beam. Knowing that the beam's effect only lasts thirty seconds, she strategically removes herself from the track to wait out the duration in a safe position rather than being a sitting duck on the course.
events.significance: Showcases Robin's intelligence and tactical thinking, turning a potential disadvantage into a strategic pause that prevents Foxy from gaining ground.

events.title: Robin Forces Foxy to Hit Himself With His Own Beam
events.description: In a brilliant tactical maneuver, Robin uses her Devil Fruit powers to force Foxy to use his Noro Noro Beam on himself. By manipulating the situation, she turns Foxy's own Devil Fruit ability against him, slowing him down with his own attack and giving the Straw Hats a decisive advantage.
events.significance: A clever reversal that demonstrates Robin's combat intelligence and her ability to turn enemies' strengths into weaknesses. This is the turning point that secures victory for the Straw Hats.

events.title: Straw Hat Pirates Win the Roller Race
events.description: With Foxy incapacitated by his own Noro Noro Beam and the rest of the Foxy Pirates unable to catch up, the Straw Hat Pirates successfully win the final round of the Roller Race. Luffy crosses the finish line (with Robin's help), securing their victory in this round of the Davy Back Fight.
events.significance: The Straw Hats' victory allows them to reclaim Chopper, who was taken by the Foxy Pirates in an earlier round. This win demonstrates the power of teamwork and tactical thinking over cheating and dirty tricks.

events.title: Chopper Returns to the Straw Hat Pirates
events.description: Following their victory in the Roller Race, the Straw Hat Pirates exercise their right as winners of the Davy Back Fight round to reclaim Tony Tony Chopper from the Foxy Pirates. Chopper is joyfully reunited with his crew, ending his brief and unwilling time with Foxy's crew.
events.significance: Resolves the tension of Chopper's capture and reinforces the Straw Hats' bond as a crew. Shows that they will fight to get their members back no matter what.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the importance of teamwork as each Straw Hat member contributes to victory in their own way. Even rivals like Zoro and Sanji work together effectively, and Robin's tactical thinking combined with everyone's efforts leads to success.
themes.symbolism: The circular track represents the crew coming full circle to reclaim Chopper, symbolizing their unbreakable bond.

themes.description: Rather than relying solely on brute force, the Straw Hats use psychological tactics, strategic thinking, and turning opponents' abilities against them. Robin's clever manipulation of Foxy's beam and Nami's strategic theft showcase that intelligence can triumph over raw power.
themes.symbolism: The roller race itself becomes a metaphor for navigating challenges through cleverness rather than just speed or strength.

themes.description: Despite Luffy's inability to skate and multiple setbacks from Foxy's cheating, the crew adapts and finds creative solutions. Robin carrying Luffy and waiting out the beam's effects shows adaptability in the face of challenges.
themes.symbolism: The 30-second duration of Foxy's beam represents how temporary setbacks can be overcome with patience and strategy.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates her tactical brilliance and combat intelligence by outsmarting Foxy. Her willingness to help Luffy despite his skating incompetence and her clever manipulation of Foxy's powers showcase her value to the crew beyond just her Devil Fruit abilities.
keyActions: Carries and rolls Luffy around the track
Strategically walks off course to wait out Foxy's beam
Forces Foxy to hit himself with his own Noro Noro Beam

characterSpotlights.development: Nami shows her strategic thinking by devising a psychological attack on Foxy, exploiting his emotional weaknesses. Even when hit by his beam, she manages to steal Porche's hypnotizing baton, preventing further disadvantages.
keyActions: Devises plan to taunt and distract Foxy
Works with Usopp on psychological warfare

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji redeems himself from earlier rounds by using his culinary knowledge to defeat Chiqicheetah. His expertise in ingredients translates to combat effectiveness, showing his multifaceted skills.
keyActions: Uses ingredient knowledge to defeat Chiqicheetah
Works effectively with Zoro despite their rivalry

characterSpotlights.development: Foxy's emotional vulnerability and reliance on his Devil Fruit powers are exposed. His fragile ego becomes a weakness that the Straw Hats exploit, and his own beam is ultimately used against him.
keyActions: Uses Noro Noro Beam on Nami and Usopp
Gets hit by his own beam due to Robin's manipulation

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Roller Race competition is anime-original filler content. In the manga, the Davy Back Fight does not include this roller skating race. The competition goes directly from the Groggy Ring to the Combat round.
Luffy's inability to roller skate is an anime-only addition for comedic effect. This character trait does not exist in the manga version of the Davy Back Fight.
Characters like Chiqicheetah and Jube who appear in this roller race are anime-original characters created specifically for these filler episodes.

trivia.fact: This episode is part of the anime's expansion of the Davy Back Fight arc. The original manga version had only three games, while the anime added three additional games including this Roller Race.
Episode 214 achieved a TV rating of 13.8%, ranking #1 in its timeslot when it aired on December 19, 2004.
This episode marked the debut abilities of anime-original characters Chiqicheetah (cheetah transformation) and Jube (fish-man flexibility and multiple arms).
The episode was broadcast in 16:9 widescreen format (HDTV), which had become the standard for One Piece starting from episode 207.
The opening theme 'Kokoro no Chizu' by BOYSTYLE that plays in this episode was the first One Piece opening to be aired in widescreen format.
